Marcus Llewellyn Ward Papers, 1906-1962

did.abstract: Professor of dentistry and dean of the School of Dentistry at University of Michigan. Personal files primarily concerning his professional interests and activities; and university files detailing his relationship with various officials.
did.physloc: Offsite storage; prior notification required for access

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was received in several accession from Dr. and Mrs. Ward (donor no. 3472)

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Marcus Llewellyn Ward Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Marcus Llewellyn Ward was born on August 5, 1875 in Howell, Michigan. He attended the University of Michigan and received from that institution the degrees of D.D.S. (1902) and D.D.Sc, (1905).

While most dentists preferred private practice, Ward's interest lay in the areas of teaching and research. He spent his entire life doing both as a member of the University of Michigan's School of Dentistry faculty. In 1903 he was named instructor of operative technics and operative dentistry. In 1905 he was named lecturer and in 1908 was made a professor. In 1912 the Dental School formally recognized Ward's changing interests when his title was changed from Professor of Operative Principles to Professor of Dental Physics and Chemistry. This change of title acknowledged Ward's pioneering research into the nature of dental cements and filling materials.

In 1919 Ward the Regents appointed Ward dean of the Dental School. He served in that position until 1934, when he resigned from the deanship but continued as a professor within the school. Between 1934 and 1945, when he retired from teaching altogether, Ward's held the title of Jonathan Taft Professor of Dentistry.

Ward's concern for dentistry carried him beyond the campus to become a key national figure within the profession. He was deeply involved with the Michigan State Dental Association, helping to revive the organization in the first decade of the twentieth century and serving as its president in 1912. He was involved with the American Association of Dental Schools, serving as that group's president in 1925. Ward was also active in the American Dental Association, once again serving in a variety of positions, including president (1939). After his retirement from teaching, Ward remained very active in professional dental organizations. He was particularly concerned about the history of the Michigan State Dental Association, helping organize that group's centennial celebration and subsequently arranging for the writing of a book length history.

scopecontent.p: The Ward papers measure four linear feet and date from 1906 to 1962. They have been divided into two series; the Personal and University Records. Both series are arranged alphabetically. The collections relates almost exclusively to his professional career and interests.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Dentistry--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
Dentists--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. School of Dentistry.

scopecontent.p: The Personal series contains information on a broad range of subjects, but generally lacks depth on any particular topic. Because Ward almost always filed correspondence by the last name of the individual it was addressed to, rather than by the institutional affiliation of the person, material about the same organization is often widely scattered. Most interesting are Ward's research files (on "Dental Cements", "Dental Fillings" and "Laboratory Laws and Technicians") and Ward's information on the Michigan State Dental Association. Most of Ward's post 1945 material relates to the history of the MSDA.

scopecontent.p: The University Records series is largely composed of Ward's correspondence while dean with various university officials, primarily the president (Marion L. Burton, Harry B. Hutchins, Clarence C. Cook, and Alexander Ruthven), vice president in charge of business (Shirley Smith), the register (Ira Smith) and the dean of the Graduate School (Alfred H. Lloyd). This series helps fill a gap in the records of the University of Michigan's School of Dentistry.
